description: Bottled in 2018 after nearly 25 years in wood, this wine is sumptuous with its rich toffee and spice flavors. They contrast with the hints of fresh acidity from the wood aging, giving a dry core to the mature sweet fruits. The wine is completely ready to drink.
title: W. & J. Graham's 1994 Single Harvest Tawny  (Port)

description: This wine shines in fresh flavors of tangerine and grapefruit. Bright acidity lends structure to the light-bodied palate, giving it an elegant and lasting impression.
title: Williams Selyem 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Lurton family-owned property has upped its game in recent vintages and this wine shows the same progress. Rich tannins and dense black fruits deliver weight and concentration. The alcohol is balanced by the fresh black-currant-flavored aftertaste to give lushness without heaviness. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Bouscaut 2016  Pessac-Léognan

description: Dominated by Sémillon, this rich, luscious wine has layers of ripe fruit and intense concentration. Wood aging has sustained the richness of the wine and not overshadowed the ripe honey, candied peel and hints of almonds. The wine will age for many years. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2016  Sauternes

description: Situated in one of the northern sectors of Margaux, this estate was created in the 13th century. This sumptuous wine has enormous power that is mitigated by the taut, mineral texture and black-currant flavors. It is a finely wrought wine that will take time to age. Drink from 2024.
title: Château la Tour de Mons 2016  Margaux

description: Now producing impressive wines, this estate has made a firm, rich wine in this vintage. Its tannins are very present, but they have a velvet edge that is immediately attractive. Not that the wine won't age: its structure and good acidity will see to that. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Lafon Rochet 2016  Saint-Estèphe

description: Packed with dark tannins and impressively rich, this wine comes from one of the estates that has shown considerable improvement over the last few vintages. Spicy, fruity and juicy with black-currant flavors, the wine will age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Rauzan-Gassies 2016  Margaux

description: While the tannins are firm, this wine's charm lies in its delicious black fruits and acidity, giving a streak of freshness to the solid texture and structure. This second wine of Château Valandraud is a fruity reflection of the more structured first wine. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Valandraud 2016 Virginie de Valandraud  (Saint-Émilion)

description: High-toned floral aromas and flavors mark this memorable, elegant and delicately textured wine, buoyant in acidity and fresh hits of tangerine, lime and a tease of caramel. The structure is impressive, suggesting potential aging, and the wine has an undeniable hint of wet stone-like mineral that lingers.
title: Cobb 2016 Mariani Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Like most Daou wines, this blend of 52% Merlot and 48% Cabernet Sauvignon only grows better as it breathes and opens over the course of days. Black rocks, blackberry and a loamy minerality kick off the nose while the palate presents strong black currant, black plum, crushed graphite, slight herb and coffee syrup flavors. Drink now through 2031.
title: Daou 2016 Micho Red (Paso Robles)

description: Sourced from a vineyard at the highest point of the appellation, close to the village of Dampierre, this is a serious, concentrated wine. It's dense, with layers of black cherry fruits, rich tannins and acidity. Wood-aged in massive 660-gallon barrels, it has a firm structure, which will allow it to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine des Roches Neuves 2017 Les Mémoires  (Saumur-Champigny)

description: Orange in color, with a dry intense mousse of great intrigue, this aged sparkling offers limestone-like mineral flavor that continues in its texture of wet stone and oyster shell. The fruit is subtle and integrated, a mix of key lime and green apple that peaks midpalate and allows the acidity to speak resoundingly on the finish. This is made from 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2013 Late Disgorged Carneros Cuvée Sparkling Rosé (Carneros)

description: The winery's stainless-fermented white is so good and such a value for the quality that it cannot be recommended highly enough. Licorice, anise and green apple combine around a steely core of crisp acidity and lengthy balance that impresses from start to finish.
title: Hanzell 2017 Sebella Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This is Catarina Vieira's single-vineyard wine from the oldest vineyard on the Rocim estate. It has density, layered black fruits and solid tannins. Firm, bold and concentrated, this is a fine wine, richly endowed and generous. Drink from 2022.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Olho de Mocho Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Blessed with some of the most stunning views in the wine world, this biodynamic winery hugs Lake Wanaka, and this vintage especially shows the maritime influence. The heady nose feels like a wild berry pie cooled on the windowsill by a breeze of salty sea air, wild herbs and hot stones. The baking spice, bramble berry and stalky notes continue onto the palate, wound tightly by grainy tannins and finishing with a streak of minerals and wild herbs. There's more power and austerity here than on the previous vintage, but it's a wine set up for cellaring, and should age gracefully until 2029.
title: Rippon 2014 Mature Vine Lake Wanaka Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: From a vineyard 1,700 feet above sea level, this light and fresh bottling tantalizes on the nose. Aromas of wild strawberry and red currant are lifted by white pepper and marjoram, while the zesty palate combines pomegranate and dried herbs.
title: Sante Arcangeli 2017 Split Rail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Spicy black-cherry and boysenberry flavors ride along a velvety palate in this lush wine. Accents of vanilla and cola add to the sumptuous nature, giving it a seductive, plush feel.
title: Three Sticks 2016 Cuvée Eva Marie Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Earthy tones dominate the nose of this bottling from John Sebastiano Vineyard, featuring aromas of forest floor, dewy thyme and pine needle. The palate pops with black-raspberry, damp sagebrush and tarragon flavors, proving very brilliant and bright.
title: Timbre 2015 The Hi-Hat Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From vineyards close to Portugal's highest mountain range, the Serra da Estrela, the wine is structured and even at four years, still young. Its dark tannins go with the rich fruit to produce a powerful, dense wine, strongly textured and with aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Quinta do Covão 2015 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Dão)

description: Old vines from a single vineyard next to the producer's winery have made a rich and dense wine. Powerful tannins march with the ripe, perfumed black fruits and strongly mineral acidity. This wine will take time to mature. Drink from 2022.
title: Charles Joguet 2016 Clos de la Dioterie  (Chinon)
